title: Judge saves the CFPB, for now
snippets: On Friday, Judge Amy Berman Jackson issued a preliminary injunction preventing the Trump administration and its Department of Government Efficiency from dismantling the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) during ongoing legal proceedings.
summary: On Friday, Judge Amy Berman Jackson issued a preliminary injunction that stops the Trump administration and its Department of Government Efficiency from breaking down the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) while legal actions are still happening.

title: Windows 11 is closing a loophole that let you skip making a Microsoft account
snippets: Microsoft has updated its Windows 11 Insider Preview, removing a bypass script that previously allowed users to set up the operating system without an internet connection and logging in. This change enforces the requirement for all Windows 11 devices to be connected to the internet and logged in during setup.
summary: Microsoft updated its Windows 11 Insider Preview, eliminating a script that let users install the OS without an internet connection and without logging in. Now, all Windows 11 devices must be connected to the internet and logged in during setup.

title: The 30 best Amazon Big Spring Sale deals under $30
snippets: Amazon's Big Spring Sale is ongoing until Monday, March 31st, offering a wide range of deals accessible without an Amazon Prime membership. The sale features over 100 deals on popular products, alongside a selection of low-cost alternatives.
summary: Amazon's Big Spring Sale, ending on March 31st, features over 100 deals on popular products, accessible to all shoppers without requiring an Amazon Prime membership. The sale also includes a variety of low-cost alternatives.

title: Elon Musk’s xAI buys Elon Musk’s X for $33 billion on paper
snippets: Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, has purchased the social media platform X, previously Twitter, in an all-stock deal. Musk valued xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, which includes $12 billion of debt. This acquisition comes years after Musk originally bought Twitter for $44 billion.
summary: Elon Musk's AI firm, xAI, has acquired the social media platform X (formerly Twitter) in an all-stock transaction, valuing xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, including $12 billion in debt. This follows Musk's initial purchase of Twitter for $44 billion years earlier.

title: Microsoft tests Quick Machine Recovery to restore PCs that can’t boot
snippets: Microsoft has begun testing Quick Machine Recovery in its latest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653) for Windows 11 devices. This feature aims to enable IT professionals to remotely recover devices that won't boot, a response to prevent incidents similar to the previous year's Crowdstrike catastrophe. The initiative was first announced by Microsoft last year.
summary: Microsoft has started testing a new feature called Quick Machine Recovery in the latest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653) for Windows 11. This tool is designed to help IT professionals remotely fix devices that fail to boot, aiming to avoid situations like last year's Crowdstrike incident. The feature was first announced by Microsoft in the previous year.

title: The Fitbit-to-Google account migration deadline moves to 2026
snippets: Google has extended the deadline for Fitbit users to migrate their accounts to a Google account until next year. This decision follows Google's acquisition of Fitbit in early 2021 and their efforts to integrate Fitbit services with Google's. Initially, users were required to make this migration by 2025.
summary: Google has postponed the requirement for Fitbit users to switch their accounts to Google accounts until next year, following its acquisition of Fitbit in 2021. The initial deadline for account migration was set for 2025.

title: The Trump administration could green-light deep-sea mining for the first time
snippets: The Metals Company (TMC), aiming to initiate deep-sea mining, has sought closer ties with the Trump administration following obstacles in international discussions. summary: The Metals Company (TMC), pursuing deep-sea mining, sought to strengthen connections with the Trump administration after facing challenges in global talks. Sponsored by Nauru in 2021, TMC aimed to speed up the creation of regulations for deep-sea mining.

title: New approach could treat anthrax beyond the 'point of no return'

title: AI meets oncology: New model personalizes bladder cancer treatment
snippets: Researchers have created an advanced model that better predicts chemotherapy outcomes for muscle-invasive bladder cancer patients by combining whole-slide tumor imaging with gene expression analyses. This approach, utilizing AI and machine learning, surpasses older models that relied on just one type of data.
summary: Researchers have developed a new model that improves predictions of chemotherapy success in muscle-invasive bladder cancer by integrating whole-slide tumor imaging with gene expression data. This method, employing AI and machine learning, outperforms previous models that only used one data type.

title: PET imaging confirms direct involvement of dopamine in cognitive flexibility
snippets: Scientists have discovered a link between dopamine and cognitive flexibility, finding that increased dopamine production in the brain improves efficiency in completing complex tasks. This discovery, made through PET imaging, could lead to better treatment methods for neurological and psychiatric disorders.
summary: Researchers have found that higher dopamine production in the brain is linked to improved cognitive flexibility, making it easier to complete complex tasks. This discovery, achieved using PET imaging, has the potential to enhance treatments for neurological and psychiatric disorders.

title: Understanding the immune response to a persistent pathogen
snippets: Researchers have discovered that the immune system can identify and manage the dormant phase of the Toxoplasma gondii parasite. This insight could help understand how to control latency in other nervous system infections.
summary: Researchers have found that the immune system can detect and control the inactive stage of the Toxoplasma gondii parasite. This discovery may aid in understanding how to manage dormant infections in the nervous system.

title: Global patterns in seed plant distribution over millions of years
snippets: A study examining nearly 270,000 seed plant species globally has identified how environmental conditions and dispersal barriers affect plant distributions. This research sheds light on why certain plants flourish in specific regions but not in others, by exploring how these patterns have evolved over millions of years.
summary: A global study of nearly 270,000 seed plant species has explored why certain plants are found in specific regions but not others. The research focused on the impact of environmental conditions and dispersal barriers on plant distributions, offering insights into the evolution of these patterns over millions of years.
